Fertilisation
During sex, sperm are 
ejaculated from a man’s 
penis into a woman’s vagina. 
In one ejaculation there may 
be more than 300 million 
sperm. Most of the sperm 
leak out of the vagina but 
some begin to swim up 
through the cervix. When 
a woman is ovulating, the 
mucus in the cervix is thinner  
than usual to let sperm 
pass through more easily. 
Sperm swim into the uterus 
and into the fallopian tubes.
